Description: Sherd of foot-plate of South Ionian pottery stemmed cup, possibly a cup with everted rim; exterior glazed black; reserved edge and underside of foot; inscription on underside.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B2 (possibly)
Curator's comments: The lack of a body and rim prevents a definitive identification of the cup as a South Ionian cup with everted rim, the shape of the foot find parallels with Schlotzhauer’s (Schlotzhauer 2012) South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 9B. Type 9B cups closely follow the shape and decoration of the Attic Plain Komast cups. These cups coincide with Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Villard’s Ionian Cup Type B2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra, and at the site of Megara Hyblaea on Sicily. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. For parallels, see Boardman and Hayes, 1966, fig. 57 no. 1277.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.587) (Phase 3)
